reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel in May last year and found it quite new & clean. I booked it again although its room rate was higher than its competitors in Pai. Disappointingly, it was poorly maintained ....the room was very dusty & dirty, the lamp & cupboard were broken. There're countless number of tiny jelly-like creatures in the swimming pool. It's suitable for photos ONLY!
reviews.title: Poor management

reviews.text: We bought 2 nights vouchers from a travel fair for this resort. Besides 2 nights stay inclusive of breakfast, it also included a half day tour of Pai and either a dinner or 1 hour massage.
reviews.title: A Lovely Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: Check-in and check-out were smooth. It was low season. We got 2 upper floor rooms connected by common deck facing the beautiful pool. The rooms were really comfortable. Loved the cement floor. Lots of shelves. Would have like better bedside reading lights. The bathroom was great too. Large rain shower area.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The resort provide 2 PCs with internet access for free in a well stocked small library.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in the mountain village of Pai

reviews.text: The Spa was pretty. Semi outdoor. I usually prefer massage in airconditioned rooms since I don't like to sweat when getting a massage. But it was pleasant. Temperature in Pai when we were there was still pretty warm in the day time (low 30'c). In the evening it dropped to around 20'c.
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be glad to come back again and again

reviews.text: The tour took us to the Tha Pai Hotspring, Yunnan Chinese Village, Pai Cannon (which I didn't climb up to since it was too hot by then), a very accessible waterfall (Mo Paeng), WWII Memorial Bridge and the famous coffee shop over looking the valley - Coffee In Love.
reviews.title: The Quarter is an excellent hotel, and one I would happily recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was great about this hotel... I would definitely stay here again. I stayed with my husband and a group of friends. It was a short walk to the main area of town. The pool was amazing, beautiful grounds, the staff was very helpful, The rooms were very cute, bed was comfortable, breakfast was great. The only (very small) complaint that I have is that our shower area was open to the outside (which was lovely), but if you don't keep the door closed from the bathroom to the bedroom, a few bugs will come to visit you! Just keep the door closed, and it's fine! I can't wait to come back to this hotel, and Pai. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed The Quarter in Pai for 3 nights by myself.
reviews.title: Picture Perfect But...

reviews.text: Excellent Value booked through Agoda (2 nights + 1 night free) during low season.
reviews.title: Useless staff

reviews.text: Garden and Swiming Pool: Well maintained and very pretty. Plenty of deck chair to sit and relax.
reviews.title: management, do something! you have a jewel in your hands!

reviews.text: This is one of the few luxury hotels in Pai. Looks great, and has comfortable rooms. The reservation process was dreadful (the hotel kept sending me incorrect comfirmations, and was very unresponsive), and although the staff is friendly the service isn't at luxury-hotel level. Got a good deal, so still feel I got value for money.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, so-so service

reviews.text: The restaurant is terrible, so definitely eat in Pai town itself.
reviews.title: Good rooms - so-so service
